secondary_street_name: 61, Lever Street and 35, Seward Street ( 37 and 39 )
description: Demolition of existing buildings and erection of a part 6, part 7 storey building over basement to provide for 161 residential units, 2587sqm of B1 (office) floorspace, 81sqm of A1 (shop/retail) floorspace and ancillary bicycle, motorcycle, and car parking provision at basement level.
decision_conditions: REASON:  The applicant has not agreed to enter into a Section 106 Legal Agreement to offset the negative externalities arising from the development to the detriment of the local and greater environment, borough roads and existing neighbouring and future residential amenities.  In particular the provision of 35% affordable housing; monies to mitigate against the likely impacts on local environment / infrastructure / facilities; the removal of residents rights to parking permits; 10% on-site renewable energy; a BREEAM Office and Eco Homes standard of 'excellent'; a contribution towards sustainable transport measures; a Green Travel Plan; the repair and reinstatement of highways and footways; the compliance with the Islington Biodiversity plan and Codes of: Employment and Training Practice, Local Procurement and Construction Practice and payment of the Council's legal fees.  The failure to agree to enter into a S106 agreement is therefore contrary to policies Env1, Env2, Env9, Env10, Env17,  Env30, Env31, Env32, H3, H10, H14, H16, H17, T4, T5, T14, T15, T23, T25, T22, T44, T45, T46, T47, T55, T56, Imp13 of the Islington Unitary Development Plan 2002 and the Council's adopted SPG 'Section 106 Community Benefits (April 2003)'.
